item.title: Debug Linux Kernel With QEMU and GDB
item.description: In last post we see how to run a raw Linux kernel in QEMU. QEMU offers another fancy feature: it can start a GDB Server and external GDB Debugger to connect. With this we can build a comfortable environment to debug system kernels and firmware. Let’s see how to leverage this feature to debug the Linux kernel.
